meanings.definition: Create or introduce new words or terms into a language.
meanings.sent1: She neologised a fun word that everyone started using.
meanings.sent2: The author neologised a term that perfectly described the character.
meanings.sent3: The teacher neologised a silly word to help students remember the lesson.
meanings.sent4: His neologised phrase became a popular trend among young people.
meanings.sent5: The comedian neologised a hilarious term that had the audience laughing.

meanings.definition: To invent or coin new words or phrases.
meanings.sent1: He neologised a catchy slogan for the campaign.
meanings.sent2: The poet neologised a beautiful phrase that touched many hearts.
meanings.sent3: The children neologised a secret language to communicate with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her neologised lyrics resonated with listeners around the world.
meanings.sent5: The scientist neologised a technical term to describe the new discovery.
